title: Babenko–Beckner inequality
summary: In mathematics, the Babenko–Beckner inequality (after K. Ivan Babenko and William E. Beckner) is a sharpened form of the Hausdorff–Young inequality having applications to uncertainty principles in the Fourier analysis of Lp spaces.  The (q, p)-norm of the n-dimensional Fourier transform is defined to be[1]
